title: TSM?  More Like TSBM
body:
Real "classy" way of closing out that last game there.

But being unprofessional jerks is one of TSM's hallmarks and the kind of behavior the organization encourages and cultivates, so why did I expect anything else from them?

I am just SO glad that the most "Ugly American" of teams gets held up as the gold standard of the region I'm from.

I hope UoL stomps them flat. (Probably not going to happen but I can dream.)

replies.body: Out of curiosity, how did they BM? I did not watch the match in question.
They just spammed emotes behind the Nexus, and let minions do most of the damage to it. Same thing that happens pretty often in regular LCS matches. OP is just salty.

> [{quoted}](name=The Big Piece,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=byo7ek6u,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-07-07T21:52:21.422+0000)
>
> They just spammed emotes behind the Nexus, and let minions do most of the damage to it. Same thing that happens pretty often in regular LCS matches. OP is just salty.

Because he is right
At the end if they day, riot is trying to promote a professional setting for LCS. It's why riot has punished professional players for behind toxic during games. They even fined Hai for throwing a middle finger when it was not shown on any stream

No reason why TSM should be spamming emotes and BMing teams. You don't ever see Koreas doing that to NA/EU despite having a monopoly in terms of dominance. I get That other reason get happy when they win so they believe they are welcomed to do it.

Stixxays interview should be a hallmark for how NA and EU need to behave. Top team in NA, dude legit says TSM is perfect to represent NA. That's called professional. If you can't act like one, probably shouldn't call yourself professional on a stream

That's just my opinion

I found it extremely classless.  But when there is talk from G2 like this beforehand

I don't think NA will win a game.   Perkz.
If Fnatic doesn't trash NA, G2 will  Mithy
I don't usually watch wild card regions  (one of the eu casters)  

Well they kind of deserved to have their noses rubbed in it.

basically the same thing that happens literally every day in solo que but when its done publicly they are suddenly literally hitler. You find me someone who has played more than 100 ranked games and hasnt spammed emote or laugh/dance / mastery on enemy nexus at least once and ill find you a lier

I haven't played more than 100 ranked games this season, but I definitely have throughout the seasons.  I've never spammed emotes or any of those things.  Though I have sat outside and tried to kill anyone who spawns.

>  Though I have sat outside and tried to kill anyone who spawns.

I doubt a player exists where when given the opportunity to do this, they would turn it down. Literally every one of my friends would do this if they were able to, and I think that because in the LCS where more or less every single player knows the others, they all have some level of friendship to an extent and it is not as "formal" to them. It is just taunting their friends. 

Plus in TSM's case, it was after a 50 minute game where if they would have lost, they would not have made the finals. So I can see it as a dance of celebration also.
Oh I have nothing against TSM.  I was simply pointing out that not all players do that.

A few seasons ago I played a lot of ranked. Never once did I do that. And I almost never see players sit there letting the minions kill nexus while dancing or using emotes to mock the enemy.

I would treat it the same in solo queue as I will here. The same disdain, and the same disappointment in my fellow players.

That's extremely unsportsmanlike. If the team representing my region did something like that I would be disappointed too.

Just because it's "regular" or 'normal' does not make it ok. That's super shitty.

> [{quoted}](name=HalcyonDweller,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=byo7ek6u,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-07T21:41:49.776+0000)
>
> Out of curiosity, how did they BM? I did not watch the match in question.

They all spammed /dance around the Nexus once all the enemy team had died and let the minions sloooowly finish off the Nexus to rub in their victory.
That's really shitty, I hate when people do petty shit like that.
because they earned the victory and are allowed to do whatever they want with it even if it hurts your feelings
That's not how decency and sportsmanship works.
Doesn't EU do that "BM" in their own region, didn't EU talk trash before the tournament started ?

> [{quoted}](name=III BAKURYU III ,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=byo7ek6u,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-07-08T02:06:57.881+0000)
>
> Doesn't EU do that "BM" in their own region, didn't EU talk trash before the tournament started ?

They do and they did.    I forget who it was but a couple of weeks ago, an EU team with a blitz hung around the fountain to snatch more kills rather than get the nexus.  BTW the Europeans got on them for it.

I believe it was Roccat or Vitality not 100% sure tho either, it was just recent as you pointed out.  The whole BM thing is harder oppose to just say " Stop it" because what is BM to begin with?  Off topic somewhat but I would rather have someone like a D-lift telling interviewers 100% real talk and "bm/s$it talk to some extent" over the same ol' " X team is really good even tho we destroyed them, but they're good tho... "LIES LIES LIES" it's so old.  

  Another thing is some teams just don't like each other, G2 Zven or Perkz I think said before Worlds " Oh, we have 2 wildcard teams in our group(CLG) LOL " when they were down on their luck at the time" 0-2 
  Xerxe saying " We can't learn much from NA" or something like that, 3-6. 

Overall it's funny how life works, at first NA trash talked and had 0 results, especially against EU; fast forward it's now EU trash talking and having 0 results against NA.

What, hanging around the nexus while the minions do most of the dmg is BM?  The death timers were all super high, so it's not like they were waiting for G2 to respawn so they could just kill them again.

You also gotta remember that in game chat is not shown to spectators, so they could have been typing in their GGs back and forth or any other closing messages to each other as we know.  Yes there were a few taunt emotes going on, but a few members stood motionless there for several seconds as well.

Besides, the amount of trash that G2 was talking before hand, like Perkz saying that NA wouldn't win a single game, or Mithy saying that G2 would destroy NA if Fnatic doesn't (kinda ironic that it is UOL that carries the hopes of EU on its shoulders), TSM had every reason to serve poetic justice not only as revenge from MSI but for NA as a whole in this tournament.

> [{quoted}](name=FlashNeko,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=byo7ek6u,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-07-07T21:38:15.023+0000)

Where in the world is this coming from?  Do you have some insights as to the ethical MO of the organization, or are you just so upset and salty that you do what just about every other upset/salty person on the internet does, which is make personal attacks that have little to do with the grand scheme of things, which in this case is the tournament?

> [{quoted}](name=GForce9x,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=byo7ek6u,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-07-07T22:06:51.492+0000)
>
> Where in the world is this coming from?  Do you have some insights as to the ethical MO of the organization, or are you just so upset and salty that you do what just about every other upset/salty person on the internet does, which is make personal attacks that have little to do with the grand scheme of things, which in this case is the tournament?

I've been following the LCS since season 2 (and got the original Championship Riven to prove it :) ) and I'm basing my statement on their public behavior as an organization, the behavior of the players over the years, and the fact Reginald has been caught in some shady business practices more than once (though amazingly, he's never fined and punished for it like other organizations have) just adds a cherry on top of things.

So it's less saltiness and more built up frustration from having seen them pull stuff like this year in and year out and it either gets ignored or people make excuses for it.

One might think this tournament is about creating rivalry trash talk.

How dare they.

NA > EU

Football players have victory dances.  Every real sport has a lot more "BM" than league, League pros are actually really courteous people.  Plus the whole point of the event is to trash talk, it's called Rift Rivals for a reason, Riot wants to play up the rivalry to hype up the big events like Worlds.  BMing is in the spirit of the event really.

Dancing at the end of the game isn't even that bad, grow up.

> [{quoted}](name=Limrick,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=byo7ek6u,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2017-07-08T19:46:33.094+0000)
>
> Football players have victory dances.  Every real sport has a lot more "BM" than league, League pros are actually really courteous people.  Plus the whole point of the event is to trash talk, it's called Rift Rivals for a reason, Riot wants to play up the rivalry to hype up the big events like Worlds.  BMing is in the spirit of the event really.
> 
> Dancing at the end of the game isn't even that bad, grow up.

On that first point, there is actually a penalty for excessive celebration and players in other sports DO get fined and/or suspended if they take their on-field trash talking/actions too far.

There's a BIG difference between doing dumb trash talking before a game and then actually being disrespectful in the game itself.

Hell, teams that are not TSM HAVE actually gotten fined for that kind of behavior during games before (most recently Roccat) so I'm just not sure why they get a free pass?
What does the B stand for?

> [{quoted}](name=KazaLyn Shao,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=byo7ek6u,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-07-08T20:52:25.882+0000)
>
> What does the B stand for?

Team Solo Bad Manners I believe is the abbreviation the op meant.

It isn't so much about disrespecting the enemy team as it is having fun with each other.  The game in question they weren't waiting for minions to kill the nexus.  They were watching biofrost and trick 1vs1 each other.  You can see the pings on the map and dl heading down to the fight.  They ended up killing the nexus right before he died.

They do stuff like this rather frequently if you listen to their shit tsm says content.  The time they tried to convince hauntzer they were fountain diving then just watched him die, the time bjerg tried taliyah wall hauntzer into the fountain, there was a time when  some one jumped into the fountain as the nexus was one hit away and then stopped damaging it to watch him die... etc

This event was specifically designed to foster (not-so)friendly regional rivalries.  It basically caters to the spastics who spam NA>EU or vise versa till their fingers fall off.  It's so obvious the players are having some fun with it and why shouldn't they?  They're being forced to play in this meaningless tournament in the middle of the summer split.  I like the idea, but they really need to reconsider the rewards and logistics in the future, or no team will ever take it seriously (besides TSM, who try-hard EVERYTHING ;) and you'll keep getting clown fiestas like this one has been.
CLG fan?
Omg someone is flashing signs in game and it hurts my feelings :´(
get over yourself. EU pulled that same shit the entire tournament. TSM outplayed every single team. They have an absolute right to brag.

I didn't mind the fountain dance, but Bjergsen's BM when he killed Exileh was just tasteless. The guy is having a hard time right now, getting a lot of flak, he didn't deserved to get danced on for getting killed by a noob champion like Syndra.
Glad UoL won that game in the end.

Exileh is the same guy that said EU brains are superior and NA is trash before the tournament. 

Don't feel bad for this moron

TSM 3-0 UOL
